intro: Androcalva johnsonii, commonly known as the Johnson's androcalva, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive floral structures and foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories, where it thrives in partial to full shade. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, displaying a range of colors from white to pale pink, and it produces capsule fruits containing minute seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
